content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #91839 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?

From the first comment: issue seems to disappear when "printing hash.first to the standard output". That's interesting. Seems to depend on the optimization opt-level-3 which influences function inlining.

So, my understanding is that this seems to be an LLVM issue (already filed on the LLVM bug tracker) and the discussion indicates that Rust does not yet support inlining for this combination of code (so to speak). Issue reporter has found a couple of ways to circumvent the issue in their tests.

For these reasons I think this might warrant a P-medium since IIUC it's not striclty a bug or a regression (rather a not fully implemented spec RFC 2045).
(Otherwise I would have bumped to P-high)
